descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course provides an introduction to selected musical cultures of the Western world. Proceeding chronologically from the Medieval era through the present day, we will consider music's intellectual and cultural contexts, its creators, and its performance to enhance our understanding of the art form as a cultural practice in specific times and places. Students will develop critical listening skills and build a working vocabulary that is meaningful to the musician and non-musician alike. Preparation of assigned reading and listening will be required of students for each class meeting; additional assignments will include quizzes, exams, essays, and concert attendance.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Course textbook: Joseph Kerman and Gary Tomlinson, Listen (8th edition; W.W. Norton, 2016). ISBN: 9780393603637
